Current Contributors[edit]

Table: Current Whonix ™ Contributors [1]

Name Role
Patrick Schleizer
  • Whonix ™ founder and lead developer
HulaHoop
  • Whonix ™ KVM contributor, miscellaneous
  • Research
  • Whonix ™ social media administrator
Jason Ayala
  • Creative consultant
  • Usability testing and feedback
  • English language fixes
  • Forum activity
TNT_BOM_BOM
  • IRC User Support
  • Testing
  • Whonix ™ wiki screenshots and Libre illustrations
  • Whonix ™ social media administrator
Devitra or Lilias_sorcha
  • IRC User Support [2]
torjunkie
  • Wiki editor and research
  • Wiki documentation audit
madaidan
  • Kernel hardening [3]
  • AppArmor improvements [4]
  • Numerous, miscellaneous security commits [5]
Sirus Shahini
  • tirdad (Tirdad kernel module for random ISN generation)
  • Security consultant
onion_knight
  • Host operating system installer, ISO live boot (Whonix-Host)

For the full list of Whonix ™ components and the respective contributor, see here. [6]

Past Contributors[edit]

Whonix ™ would not exist in its current form without the significant efforts of numerous contributors from the community. Gratitude is expressed to all past contributors, big or small.

Table: Previous Whonix ™ Contributors [7]

Name Contributions
smarm
  • TorBOX wiki editor
  • English language fixes
  • python leaktest script creation
  • Contact: smarm [at] hushmail dot com
Cypherpunks / Anonymous
  • TorBOX build shell script creation
  • Initial TorBOX binary releases [8]
  • Rewrote the TorBOX guide for VirtualBox, instead of VMware [9]
  • Improved the iptables firewall configuration and added a hardening section [10]
Joshua
  • Previous forum moderator at the legacy sourceforge Whonix ™ forum
  • Contributed a phone number so the Google+ and Youtube Whonix ™ accounts could be created
  • Documentation feedback
  • Tested Whonix ™ images
scarp
  • Feedback on Whonix ™ source code and change commits
  • Reviewed Whonix ™ build documentation
  • Tested building Whonix ™ from source code
  • Helped integrate TorChat into Whonix ™
  • Reviewed matters concerning public relations
Anonymous
  • Documentation feedback
CJ
  • Created the original TorBOX logo
Cuan Knaggs
  • Created the Whonix ™ stream isolation graphic
  • Contact: revolver print media for graphical web design, web development, cms and e-commerce
fortasse
  • whonix.org server administrator
  • Forum activity
WhonixQubes
  • First Whonix ™ integration into Qubes
IronSoldier
  • IRC User Support
Ego
  • Whonix ™ Windows installer [11]
  • Forum user support and forum moderator
entropy
  • Testing
  • Forum user support and forum moderator
troubadour
  • Tor Controller GUI and sdwdate-GUI contributor
  • AppArmor profiles
  • Whonix ™ Setup Wizard [12]
  • msgdispatcher_dispatch_x
  • sdwdate-gui
  • Tor Controller GUI
  • Miscellaneous
0brand
  • Testing, miscellaneous commits [13]
  • Wiki editor and research
  • Forum user support and forum moderator
  • Whonix ™ Windows Installer
mig5
  • OnionShare contributor
iry
  • Anon Connection Wizard contributor
  • Miscellaneous
Inga Bemman
  • GI Engineer, contributor
Algernon
  • VM Live Mode contributor
  • Whonix ™ CLI contributor
  • Raspberry Pi Whonix-Gateway ™ contributor [14]
  • XFCE Desktop Environment [15]

Project Statements[edit]

The personal opinions of moderators or contributors to the Whonix ™ project do not represent the project as a whole.

Footnotes[edit]

  1. ↑ Contributors are listed in rough chronological order.
  2. ↑ https://forums.whonix.org/t/whonix-irc-channel-status/5367

  4. ↑ https://forums.whonix.org/t/full-system-mac-policy/8339
  5. ↑ Including systemd sandboxing, blacklisting of uncommon network protocols, restricting hardware information to root, and more restrictive Whonix ™ file permissions.
  6. ↑ Interested readers can also refer to a previous forum discussion about Whonix ™ contributors.
  7. ↑ Contributors are listed in rough chronological order. Please add your name / handle and contribution(s) here if they have not already been listed. Wiki administrators will confirm your contributions prior to publication.
  8. ↑ February 2012; TorBOX was a forerunner to Whonix ™.
  9. ↑ February 2012.
  10. ↑ February 2012.
  11. ↑ Past role: Wiki translations coordinator.
  12. ↑ Forerunner to Anon Connection Wizard.
  13. ↑ See Comments to use Qubes onion repository.
  14. ↑ See Whonix ™ for arm64.
  15. ↑ https://forums.whonix.org/t/whonix-xfce-development/6213
